‏بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم

I was asked by a number of my ig fam to go into this Reflection a bit more. Explaining how can one support a revert and what is this experience like. 

STORY TIME

My very first Ramadan as a Revert 

I remember It as clear as day I was not wearing hijab at the time and therefore I didn’t really have muslim community because I didn’t look apparently muslim. 

I just wanted  make sure to eat before the sun came up; Because my head  was killing me all day, and this is where I gained a whole new respect for Muslims who fast for Ramadan. 

I didn’t know my fast was not accepted if I didn’t pray . 

I didn’t know how to pray 

I didn’t know how to be muslim .

I didn’t see things the same way as my friends who did not take Shahaddah because they probably were already muslim in their hearts.

I wore my head wraps because i wanted it to be apparent I’m African. 

I was judged for being muslim and still working jn the music industry at this time. I thought to myself their are so many Muslim men rapping. Why can’t I ?

I would sit amongst Muslims who were born into Islam through their cultures and the Arabic language, they would speak about their experiences and ask me have you gone on umrah yet

I didn’t even know how to pray my Salat let alone know what umrah even was at the time 

I want to pause here and continue with video because this has been such a personal journey I want to be able to express it more in detail verbally inshallah. 

Suffering nourishes compassion, We should be around those who suffer as a reminder 
-Thich Nhat Hanh

#revertstories  #revert #peaceiseverystep  #islam #muslim

BOSHIA’S SKINCARE SECRETS 

PEACE YALL IM BOSHIA AND I STARTED TO DEVLOP AN INTEREST FOR SKINCARE SINCE I WAS 14 years when my mom And grandmother would show me how to properly wash my face and have shown me ways to remove pimples blemishes and  acne thought out my teenage years into adulthood . 

I’m excited to share some of those secrets but with skincare cosmetics that help you achieve the same results . 

#boshia #skincare #secrets #beauty  #skincaretips #skinhealth #skingoals #skingoals

social_posts.post_text:
‏بسم الله الرحمن 
Al-Husayn 
Thank Allah for all the people who sacrificed for me to be a muslim alhumdoulilah I can’t take this for granted it’s far to precious . 

Al-Husayn
Muhammad described him and his brother, Hasan, as “the leaders of the youth of Paradise.”

Born ‏
‏January 626 is a grandson of the Islamic prophet Muhammad and a son of Ali ibn Abi Talib and Muhammad’s daughter Fatima, as well  as a younger brother of Hasan 
Being a grandson of the prophet, he is a member of the Ahl al-Bayt. One of the moral characteristics of Husayn is Tolerance, humility, eloquence, and finally traits that can be deduced from his behavior, such as despising death, hatred of a shameful life, pride, and the like

Verse 15 of Surah Al-Ahqaf talks about a pregnant woman who endures a lot of pain and suffering. This verse is considered a reference to Fatima Zahra, and the son is also known as Husayn, when God expressed his condolences to Muhammad about the fate of this grandson and Muhammad expressed this to Fatima Zahra, she was very upset.

There are narrations that Jibrel informed Muhammad at the time of Husayn’s birth that his ummah would kill Husayn and that the Imamate would be from Husayn, and that Muhammad informed his companions of how Husayn had been killed. Except for Muhammad, Ali and Hasan, they had said the same thing. God also informed the previous prophets about the killing of Husayn.[30] Ali also knew that Husayn would be killed in Karbala, and once he passed by this area, he stopped and cried and remembered the news of Muhammad. He interpreted Karbala as anguish and calamity. The slain of Karbala will enter Paradise without any reckoning.

References : Quran , Wikipedia . Sahih Muslim 

#alhusayn  #hussaini #islam #marhaban #rasulullah #egypt #cairo #love #light #qasidah #alhusseinmosque

‏بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم

Living in muslim countries has changed me , I have been writing  everyday reflecting on my actions and experiences. Loving with compassion and without fear but most of All wanting to feel Allah near talking to Rasuallah and missing my sweet tears in the Rawdah where I felt the presence of the perfect man comfort me and remove my pain. 

I have healed so much and I’m ready to share all this love by sharing more art collections and  summarizing some  beautiful reflections . 

My heart is filled with love so much love I want to cry 
When I see people suffering anywhere in any place. I cannot hide the love Al Wudud  ya Allah purify my heart and heal the Ummah strengthen us to love you more than this world. 

#art  #poet #fashion #creativewriting  #creativedirection  #egypt  #love  #sufi #poetry  #writer #muslimah

Yemen, Hadramawnt: Reflections of Reverence

Asalamu Alyaka Nabi Hud, Prophet HUD
Ya Allah I know I didn’t  deserve this 
I still feel underserving please Ya Rab make me worthy 

Tarim,Yemen  Journal entry 08/29/22
I have gazed upon the maqam of Your beloveds with my sisters as we cry tears of reverence; as we enter into the night with stars glistening their bright light reminding us of the pure love we are given Ya Allah . 

Hud  was a prophet of ancient Arabia mentioned in the Quran.The eleventh chapter of the Quran, Hud, is named after him, though the narrative of Hud comprises only a small portion of the chapter.

The people of ʿĀd were extremely powerful and wealthy and they built countless buildings[and monuments to show their power. However, the ʿĀd people's wealth ultimately proved to be their failure, as they became arrogant and forsook God and began to adopt idols for worship, including three named Samd, Samud and Hara. Hud, even in childhood, remained consistent in prayer to God. It is related through exegesis that Hud's mother, a pious woman who had seen great visions at her son's birth, was the only person who encouraged Hud in his worship.Thus, the Lord raised up Hud as a prophet for the ʿĀd people.

Hud is referred to in the Baháʼí Faith as a Prophet who appeared after Noah and prior to Abraham, who exhorted the people to abandon idolatry and practice monotheism. His endeavors to save His people resulted in their "willful blindness" and His rejection

References: Quran, Wikipedia 

#nabialhuda  #prophethud  #HUD #tarım #yemen 
#tareem #tareemlovers

The Tree of my Dreams 
By Boshia Raejean 
————————————
Shaykh Ibrāhīm Niasse
I felt the breeze of your soul
It cooled me down 
in the kolack heat 
I remembered what it felt like 
to be sitting at your feet 
When I entered your home in Kossi Baye I realized 
that I had been here 
In Awww  of the surreality 
when I stepped out to stand where you stood
And  gaze upon the tree 
I kept seeing in my dreams 
Before Allah made me
A being that submits to peace 

Missing you Senegal 🇸🇳 missing my Madinah Baye 🥹

O, BELIEVER OF THE MOST LOVING ,DO NOT FEAR LOVE EMBRACE IT LIKE YOU DRINK OXYGEN . LET IT HEAL YOU

Eid Day 1 was so beautiful and I’m blessed beyond words to say that I was able to spend the first day in Milano,Italy and meet the beautiful muslim community there .

Me and  my friend walked for over 30 min on Arafat, whilst fasting we realized we didn’t bring anything to break our fast with as we walked into this lovely masjid there were dates and cold water  waiting for us .

Whenever you travel for the sake of Allah you Will be blessed beyond your wildest dreams . When you travel because of love the conditions do not matter only the love does. Only  the reality of growing forget for the sake of Allah.

‏بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم

Eid Day 2 Alhumdoulilah what a blessing it is to be a muslim . Feeling so content on this beautiful day. Morroco was like going  to another time . Alhumdoulilah

Fez was everything I prayed for and more. Shaykh Ahmad Tijani, and it is reported that he used to engage so much in spiritual retreat (khalwa) that he would have to walk to the five prayers in the mosque with his face covered, otherwise onlookers would fall so heedlessly in love with him that they would thereafter never be able to separate from him. Shaykh Tijani’s mother, Aisha, was the daughter of Muhammad b. Sanusi (no known relation to Muhammad al-Sanusi, the founder of the Sanusiyya), and was noted for her piety and generosity.

The young Shaykh Ahmad Tijani continued in the scholarly tradition of his family and city, memorizing the Qur’an by the age seven before turning to the study of jurisprudence (fiqh and usul al-fiqh), Prophetic traditions (Hadith), explanation of the Qur’an (tafsir), Qur’anic recitation (tajwid), grammar (nahw) and literature (adab), among other branches of the traditional Islamic sciences.
Ameeeeeen Y’a Rabi

I never in my life wore niqab for an extended period of time it really inspired me to write this poem and talk more about my experience wearing niqab. I’m not sure if I can see me self committing  to wearing it everyday , Allahualam, but it truly was a means to become closer to Allah. 
___________________________

A Veil That Removes Veils 
By @boshiaraejean 

Allah guided me to go 
To a blessed land 
Where black garments flow 
Elegance meets Eloquence
Where the language of the angels is spoken,Arabic 
I found myself aligned 
With the path Allah 
Provides seeing the new me 
Truly not prepared my heart 
Abundant and clear 
Noor cleaned it so 
All The tears could flow 
One day did not pass where 
The veils were being lifted , wearing niqab was truly gifted 
To me by Allah I understand now who I must become 
For this veil removes veils 
To bring us closer to the one 

AllahuAkbar 
___________________
#veil  #niqab  #niqabstory  #muslimah  #niqaab #poetry  #poetrycommunity  #muslimpoet #poems #poetsociety

Journal Entry 
09/3/22
From living  in Tarim to Mokattam

So I had a bit of an anxiety attack before leaving Yemen 
I can’t  stop crying so in my hotel room,  I’m  so afraid to step out without niqab I don’t  know how to be or how to speak to men it is quite a beautiful actually. A new level of hiya growing  in me Alhumdoulilah. 
I pray it changes  the way I dress and just carry myself in general. 

I’m so grateful……..

Alhumdoulilah

ALHUMDOULILAH for PURE LIGHT 
 ⛅️ this cloud is happy 🤍. 
Seeking Self knowledge, 

Imam al Ghazzali, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Know that the key to knowing God is to know your own self.
Therefore, says Imam al Ghazzali in “The Alchemy of Happiness”, you must seek out the truth about yourself: What sort of thing are you? Where did you come from? Where are you going? What is the purpose of your creation? What is happiness and where does it lie? What is misery and where does it lie?

#selfie  #knowledgeispower  #knowledgeofself #imamalghazali

‏بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم

Allah says in the Holy Quran Chapter 7 Surah Al Aaraf verse173-174: This We did lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection, “We were unaware of this thing.” Or lest you should say, “Our forefathers started the practice of ‘shirk’ before us and we were born after them to their descendants. Do You, then, punish us for the sin that was committed by the wrong-doers?” Behold, this is how We make Our Signs clear, so that these people may return to Us.

First Rawdah 
Journal Entry 
11/21/2022

Alhumdoulilah 

First Rawdah 
Journal Entry 
11/21/2022

for you ‎ﷺ are the most beloved of humanity ‎ﷺ you are truly the first true love I have ever felt in my existence. I struggle to be the best of what Allah made me to be . Ya Rasuallah  ﷺ  I want to  heal Im hurting, but when I hear your salawat ‎ﷺ it’s a balm on my heart. I’m coming to ‎ masjid Al Nabawi ‎ tired and a struggling heart in pain …….

I left everything in the Rawdah like my sister told me to do leave all my worries and pain with you ‎ﷺ.

Rasullah ‎ﷺ you have sacrificed and  guided me you have prayed for  me to amongst your nation. Praying to see you in my dreams 
Ameeen.

#masjidnabawi  #prophetmuhammadﷺ  #rabiulawal  #madinamunawara  #journalentry

All the trials and all the struggles you place in my path are all because you love me and want me to submit. 

My teacher Imam Al Ahzary said that the saints would reach such a station where they would say 
To Allah “I love you, tourment me how you like “…. And smile through the difficulties because they new that they were experiencing the 2 depths of Allah Jamal & Jalal

SubannahAllah these tears are a purification for my soft heart

The Holy Lands Merciful Door
By @boshiaraejean 
Ever since I was blessed with the opening to go to  Palestine, I keep seeing images of the old city in mind from time to time. The beautiful struggle of Bethlehem the hero’s of Hebron the Regalness of Rammahlla , joy of Jerusalem … the first night in Palestine me my sis  were in Baab Al Rahmmah amungst tethered welcomed with love chai .. and cookies 🖤❤️💚🤍
My heart is hurting knowing that our home is suffering Allah did not make us to be residence of one place because his house is the world. Missing the Holy Land  praying to always be tethered to your door of mercy. 

PHILISTINE YOU ARE BEAUTIFUL…. Even when evil tries bully you with genocide and lies. 

#poetry #poem  #love #peace  #justice #truth #reality #doorofmercy #freepalestine

‏بسم الله رقمان الرحيم

QUEENS YOU MATTER , I SEE YOU 

So humbled by the openings Allah reveals in abundance every day . When I stopped chasing perfection in this world I realized that Allah guided  me through  to belittle my connection to a worldly perfection and to only seek perfection in his majesty and grandeur. 

So humbled and blessed 

Alhumdoulilah for everything

Litany for
Victory in
P@list!ne  and
Masjid al-Aqsa
Habib Umar ibn Hafi.

May Allah preserve him 

LITANY FOR PALESTINE & MASJID AL-AQSA
SUPPLICATION NO.5
Recite 10 times
ENGLISH
O God, send prayers of blessings and peace upon our Master Muhammad, he whom You sent on a Night Journey from the Masjid al-Haram to Masjid al-Aqsâ, and You ascended him to Highest of Heavens, and upon his Family and Companions - the best of leaders, and upon those who follow them in excellence.
Awaken the hearts of the Muslims and ruin the plots of Your enemies from the Jews who are invading Bayt al-Maqdis, and all those who are in allegiance with them, those people of evil upon the earth, and defend us and the people of “There is no deity but God” from their evil and harm. Inspire us with our guidance in every movement and stillness, O Most Merciful of those who are merciful. #liberation  #truth #love  #liberate

Never Forget your responsibility

#artistsoninstagram #artist  #truth  #truthseeker

Ar Raqib
‏الرقيب 

Alahumdoulilah today we went over how we can really understand how to connect this name to our daily lives. Whether it is setting intentions with our family, with our life goals, and specially our spiritual ones, I pray this is beneficial to all that get to view it as I am currently reflecting on how I can incorporate this attribute of Allah in my life  every day.

#99namesofallah  #allah  #arraqib #Allah #islam #truth

‏لا اله الا الله
“I bear witness that there is no deity but God”!!!!!!
‏الحمد لله بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم
PHILISTINEEEEEE!!!!! 🇵🇸🇵🇸”
REMINDS YOU OF THE TRIE MEANING OF TAWHID”
-boshia 

Let me just start by saying how much honor Allah have the Muslim in protecting the Christians and the Jews ,in a  time where they needed protection from Crusaders, and refuge, let us not forget our unity in this time.

God reminds us that there are no partners that he is one god,

 

Al-Ikhlas

Say: “He is Allah, the One and Unique; (1) Allah, Who is in need of none and of Whom all are in need; (2) He neither begot any nor was He begotten, (3) and none is comparable to Him.” (4)

So the unity is in the prophets and how they Al practiced Islam and their covenant is with  Allah and humanity alone. 

I was so blessed to have to the opportunity to go to Jerusalem, for Ramadan and see, that’s very unity the way the Muslim protect the church of the holy sepulcher, a pilgrimage in which Christians go to, and the way Muslims opened their home up to Jews to call home. 

On the second photo, what you can find is the treaty Omar ibn  Khattab and how it says all religions can practice  here safely . I’m praying we can all return back to  the holyland to witness this reality of unity.
And see how Islam is a gift that can only be given by Allah. 

On the real though….
 I’m missing Palestine so much I was reminded of the importance of dawah today by my teacher. Perhaps that why Allah aligned @shahadahsessions  to be on my path. 

May Allah bless it and put baraqa in it for all who are making it what Allah knows it to be. Alhumdoulilah  thank you y’a Allah  for bringing me home and showing me TAWEED!!!

i dreamed of this more than once to come face to truth at  the place where our beloved 
Prophet Muhammad ‎ﷺ ascended. 

قُبّة الصَخْرةِ
(The Dome of the Rock)
What an honor to return home 
Allah is with us we are never alone 
For Allah is the one who calls us home 
Will you be scrolling on your phone 
Alhumdoulilah for This night is a reminder 
a journey, a true  miracle and blessing

Al-Isra’ wal-Mi’raj - that the Prophet (saw) was transported from al-Masjid al-Haram to al-Masjid al-Aqsa, from where he (saw) ascended to heaven.

Bismillah ‏
بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم
What does it truly mean to die before you die? I’m still discovering it parts of me, whether a way to never be present again to never want those parts of me to be present again.

Only to feel more alive as parts of me die. 

 To only want to be annihilated in pure perfection.
I truly feel a small death when I’m in the desert, or in the mosque away from the world in seclusion alone with my Lord.

#ramadan #poet  #storytime
